item.text: Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath, and his disciples picked some heads of wheat, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="5330" class="">Pharisees</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="5101">Why</st> are you<n id="2" /> <st data-num="4160" class="">doing</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">what</st> is <st data-num="3756">against</st> the <st data-num="1832">law</st><n id="3" /> on the <st data-num="4521" class="">Sabbath</st>?”

<st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="611" class="">answered</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="3761">Haven’t</st> you <st data-num="314" class="">read</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">what</st> <st data-num="1138" class="">David</st> <st data-num="4160" class="">did</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="3753" class="">when</st> <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="846">his</st> <st data-num="3588 3326">companions</st> were <st data-num="3983" class="">hungry</st>—

<st data-num="5613" class="">how</st> he <st data-num="1525" class="">entered</st> the <st data-num="3624" class="">house</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>, <st data-num="2983" class="">took</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2068" class="">ate</st> the <st data-num="4286" class="">sacred</st> <st data-num="740" class="">bread</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="3739" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1832" class="">lawful</st><n id="3" /> for any to <st data-num="2068">eat</st> <st data-num="1508">but</st> the <st data-num="2409" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="3441" class="">alone</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="1325" class="">gave</st> it to <st data-num="846">his</st> <st data-num="3588 3326">companions</st>?”<n id="5" />
Then he said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
On another Sabbath, Jesus entered the synagogue and was teaching. Now a man was there whose right hand was withered.

The <st data-num="1122" class="">experts in the law</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="5330" class="">Pharisees</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="3906" class="">watched</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="846" class="">Jesus</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="3906" class="">closely</st> to see <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> he would <st data-num="2323" class="">heal</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="4521" class="">Sabbath</st>,<n id="5" /> <st data-num="2443" class="">so that</st> they could <st data-num="2147" class="">find</st> a reason to <st data-num="2723" class="">accuse</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">knew</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="1261" class="">thoughts</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="1161" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st> to the <st data-num="435" class="">man</st> who <st data-num="2192" class="">had</st> the <st data-num="3584" class="">withered</st> <st data-num="5495" class="">hand</st>, “<st data-num="1453" class="">Get up</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2476" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="3319">here</st>.”<n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">So</st><n id="5" /> he <st data-num="450" class="">rose</st> and <st data-num="2476" class="">stood</st> there.

<st data-num="1161" class="">Then</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “I <st data-num="1905" class="">ask</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>,<n id="2" /> is it <st data-num="1832" class="">lawful</st> to <st data-num="15">do good</st> on the <st data-num="4521" class="">Sabbath</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> to <st data-num="2554">do evil</st>, to <st data-num="4982" class="">save</st> a <st data-num="5590" class="">life</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> to <st data-num="622">destroy</st> it?”

After<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4017">looking around</st><n id="2" /> at <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st>, he <st data-num="3004">said</st> to the <st data-num="846" class="">man</st>,<n id="3" /> “<st data-num="1614">Stretch out</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="5495" class="">hand</st>.” The man<n id="4" /> <st data-num="4160" class="">did</st> so, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="5495" class="">hand</st> was <st data-num="600" class="">restored</st>.<n id="5" />
But they were filled with mindless rage and began debating with one another what they would do to Jesus.
Now it was during this time that Jesus went out to the mountain to pray, and he spent all night in prayer to God.

<st data-num="3753" class="">When</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2250" class="">morning</st> <st data-num="1096" class="">came</st>, he <st data-num="4377" class="">called</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="3101" class="">disciples</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1586" class="">chose</st> <st data-num="1427" class="">twelve</st> <st data-num="575" class="">of</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, <st data-num="3739" class="">whom</st> he <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="3687" class="">named</st> <st data-num="652" class="">apostles:</st><n id="2" />

<st data-num="4613" class="">Simon</st><n id="1" /> (<st data-num="3739">whom</st> he <st data-num="3687" class="">named</st> <st data-num="4074" class="">Peter)</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="80" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="406" class="">Andrew;</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2385" class="">James</st>, <st data-num="2491" class="">John</st>, <st data-num="5376" class="">Philip</st>, <st data-num="918" class="">Bartholomew</st>,<n id="2" />

<st data-num="3156" class="">Matthew</st>, <st data-num="2381" class="">Thomas</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2385" class="">James</st> the son of <st data-num="256" class="">Alphaeus</st>, <st data-num="4613" class="">Simon</st> who was <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> the <st data-num="2207" class="">Zealot</st>,<n id="2" />
Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.

Then he came down with them and stood on a level place. And a large number of his disciples had gathered along with a vast multitude from all over Judea, from Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon. They came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> those who <st data-num="1776" class="">suffered</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="169" class="">unclean</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="4151" class="">spirits</st> were <st data-num="2323" class="">cured</st>.
The whole crowd was trying to touch him because power was coming out from him and healing them all.

Then he looked up at his disciples and said:

“Blessed are you who are poor, for the kingdom of God belongs to you.

Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied.

Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude you and insult you and reject you as evil on account of the Son of Man!
Rejoice in that day, and jump for joy because your reward is great in heaven. For their ancestors did the same things to the prophets.
But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your comfort already.

Woe to you who are well satisfied with food now, for you will be hungry.

Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
Woe to you when all people speak well of you, for their ancestors did the same things to the false prophets.
“But I say to you who are listening: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,

<st data-num="2127" class="">bless</st> those who <st data-num="2672" class="">curse</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>, <st data-num="4336" class="">pray</st> <st data-num="4012" class="">for</st> those who <st data-num="1908" class="">mistreat</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>.

To the person who <st data-num="5180" class="">strikes</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="4600" class="">cheek</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3930" class="">offer</st> the <st data-num="243" class="">other</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">as well</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> the person who <st data-num="142">takes away</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="2440" class="">coat</st>,<n id="3" /> do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2967" class="">withhold</st> your <st data-num="5509" class="">tunic</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">either</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="1325" class="">Give</st> to <st data-num="3956" class="">everyone</st> who <st data-num="154" class="">asks</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="523" class="">ask for</st> <st data-num="4674">your possessions</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="523" class="">back</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> the person who <st data-num="142" class="">takes</st> them <st data-num="142">away</st>.
Treat others in the same way that you would want them to treat you.
“If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1437" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="15" class="">do good</st> to those who <st data-num="15">do good</st> to <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>, <st data-num="4169" class="">what</st> <st data-num="5485" class="">credit</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> that to <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>? <st data-num="2532">Even</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="268" class="">sinners</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="4160" class="">do</st> the <st data-num="846" class="">same</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="1437" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="1155" class="">lend</st> to those <st data-num="3844" class="">from</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">whom</st> you <st data-num="1679" class="">hope</st> to be <st data-num="2983">repaid</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4169" class="">what</st> <st data-num="5485" class="">credit</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> that to <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>? <st data-num="2532">Even</st> <st data-num="268" class="">sinners</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1155" class="">lend</st> to <st data-num="268" class="">sinners</st>, <st data-num="2443">so that</st> they may be <st data-num="618" class="">repaid</st> in <st data-num="2470" class="">full</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="4133" class="">But</st> <st data-num="25" class="">love</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="2190" class="">enemies</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="15">do good</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1155" class="">lend</st>, <st data-num="560" class="">expecting</st> <st data-num="3367" class="">nothing</st> back.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="3408" class="">reward</st> will <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">great</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> you will <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="5207" class="">sons</st><n id="3" /> of the <st data-num="5310">Most High</st>,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="3754" class="">because</st> <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="5543" class="">kind</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">to</st> <st data-num="884" class="">ungrateful</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4190" class="">evil people</st>.<n id="5" />
Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
“Do not judge, and you will not be judged; do not condemn, and you will not be condemned; forgive, and you will be forgiven.
Give, and it will be given to you: A good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be poured into your lap. For the measure you use will be the measure you receive.”
He also told them a parable: “Someone who is blind cannot lead another who is blind, can he? Won’t they both fall into a pit?

A <st data-num="3101" class="">disciple</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="5228">greater than</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1320" class="">teacher</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">everyone</st> when <st data-num="2675">fully trained</st> will <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">like</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1320" class="">teacher</st>.

<st data-num="5101" class="">Why</st><n id="1" /> do you <st data-num="991">see</st> the <st data-num="2595" class="">speck</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="80" class="">brother’s</st> <st data-num="3788" class="">eye</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="3756">fail</st> to <st data-num="3756" class="">see</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="1385">beam of wood</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="2398">your own</st>?

How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck from your eye,’ while you yourself don’t see the beam in your own? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
“For no good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit,

<st data-num="1063" class="">for</st> <st data-num="1538" class="">each</st> <st data-num="1186" class="">tree</st> is <st data-num="1097" class="">known</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> its <st data-num="2398" class="">own</st> <st data-num="2590" class="">fruit</st>. <st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> <st data-num="4810" class="">figs</st> are <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="4816" class="">gathered</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> <st data-num="173" class="">thorns</st>, <st data-num="3761" class="">nor</st> are <st data-num="4718" class="">grapes</st> <st data-num="5166" class="">picked</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> <st data-num="942" class="">brambles</st>.<n id="4" />
The good person out of the good treasury of his heart produces good, and the evil person out of his evil treasury produces evil, for his mouth speaks from what fills his heart.
“Why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do what I tell you?
“Everyone who comes to me and listens to my words and puts them into practice—I will show you what he is like:

He <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3664" class="">like</st> a <st data-num="444" class="">man</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3618" class="">building</st> a <st data-num="3614" class="">house</st>, <st data-num="3739" class="">who</st> <st data-num="4626" class="">dug down</st> <st data-num="900" class="">deep</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5087" class="">laid</st> the <st data-num="2310" class="">foundation</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">on</st> <st data-num="4073" class="">bedrock</st>. When<n id="3" /> a <st data-num="4132" class="">flood</st> <st data-num="1096" class="">came</st>, the <st data-num="4215" class="">river</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="4366">burst against</st> <st data-num="1565" class="">that</st> <st data-num="3614" class="">house</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">but</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="2480" class="">could</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="4531" class="">shake</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">because</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st> had been <st data-num="2570" class="">well</st> <st data-num="3618" class="">built</st>.<n id="6" />

But the person who hears and does not put my words into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the river burst against that house, it collapsed immediately and was utterly destroyed!”
